thread.title: flyADVANCED adds Falcon 50EX, King Air B350 to its fleet
thread.title_full: flyADVANCED adds Falcon 50EX, King Air B350 to its fleet

author: eTN Global Editor
title: flyADVANCED adds Falcon 50EX, King Air B350 to its fleet
text:
flyADVANCED adds Falcon 50EX, King Air B350 to its fleet   
Aug 11, 2015 flyADVANCED charter King Air B350i Banners   
WILMINGTON, DE - flyADVANCED announced the addition of two planes to their charter fleet: a 2001 Falcon 50EX and a 2013 King Air B350i to their charter fleet. 
"The addition of these two planes brings our charter fleet to a total of 10 aircraft, ranging from single engine piston to heavy jet," noted Regis de Ramel, President and CEO of flyADVANCED. "This is a direct benefit to our clients who may seek different solutions at a variety of price points depending on their travel needs. In some instances, depending on the distance and the number of people traveling, a jet may be appropriate. For that same client in other circumstances, a four-seat Cirrus may achieve the results they need at a better price." 
flyADVANCED operates from three mid-ATLANTIC locations: Wilmington, Delaware (KILG), Blue Bell, PA (KLOM) and Lancaster (KLNS), the latter dedicated exclusively to piston aircraft maintenance and repairs. 
In addition to the newly added Falcon 50EX and King Air B350i, flyADVANCED also offers a Bombardier Challenger CL601, Gulfstream IV, Raytheon Beechjet 400A, Beechcraft King Air B100, Cirrus SR22, Cirrus CR22T and Cirrus SR22 GS. 
"Even the flyADVANCED Aircraft Owners Group will sometimes find a different aircraft to be a better solution for their travel needs," noted de Ramel. "Given the breadth of our fleet and its location, flyADVANCED can provide a variety of air transportation solutions with a single phone call. That is and has always been the client advantage of Integrated Aircraft Management."
